<url>http://www.zotero.org/support/lib/tpl/zotero-theme/images/favicon.ico</url>     </image>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/addcitationdialog_raised?rev=1336421328&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-05-07T16:08:48-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:addcitationdialog_raised</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/addcitationdialog_raised?rev=1336421328&do=diff</link>         <description>Can I prevent the "Add Citation" dialog from the word processor plugins from moving behind the word processor window?  Yes, by changing the hidden preference extensions.zotero.integration.keepAddCitationDialogRaised.  kb,  word processors</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/adding_a_letter_or_memo?rev=1303777058&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:17:38-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:adding_a_letter_or_memo</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/adding_a_letter_or_memo?rev=1303777058&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I add a letter or memo?  Click the green new item button and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdLetter\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Use Author for the sender of the letter. To add a recipient click the + sign on the author line in the right column. This will create an additional Author line. If you click the triangle to the left of the new author field you will be able to change Author to Recipient. Enter the type of letter (memo, telegram, etc.) in the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdType\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field. On entering archival information, see How do I add an archival or other unp\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/addon_could_not_be_downloaded?rev=1422577593&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-01-29T19:26:33-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:addon_could_not_be_downloaded</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/addon_could_not_be_downloaded?rev=1422577593&do=diff</link>         <description>"The add-on could not be downloaded because of a connection failure on www.zotero.org."  This message previously could appear when attempting to download Zotero Firefox extensions on systems or networks that intercepted secure (HTTPS) connections to zotero.org. We've since put a workaround in place that allows installations to take place over such connections.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/address_bar_icon_appears_slowly?rev=1302056318&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:18:38-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:address_bar_icon_appears_slowly</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/address_bar_icon_appears_slowly?rev=1302056318&do=diff</link>         <description>Sometimes the icon for a book/article/etc doesn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt appear in the address bar right away. What\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds going on?  Zotero must wait for the entire page to load before it can check for an item on the page. Sometimes there are elements of the page (a large image, e.g.) that take time to load and thus delay Zotero\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds activity.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/ams_alphabetic?rev=1303751214&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T13:06:54-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:ams_alphabetic</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/ams_alphabetic?rev=1303751214&do=diff</link>         <description>Does Zotero support label/authorship trigraph styles, like [ddb98]?  Not yet. A forum thread about this topic can be found .  kb,  styles</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/annotation_sync?rev=1330594550&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-03-01T04:35:50-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:annotation_sync</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/annotation_sync?rev=1330594550&do=diff</link>         <description>Do annotations of snapshots sync?  HTML snapshots  Zotero syncing does not include the annotations and highlighting you have made on HTML snapshots using Zotero's (no longer maintained) annotation feature.  PDFs  If you annotate your PDF files using third-party software (such as Adobe Professional, FoxIt, PDF-XChange, or Mac OS X's Preview) that writes annotations to the file, the synced file will include your annotations.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/archival_or_other_unpublished_sources?rev=1303777032&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:17:12-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:archival_or_other_unpublished_sources</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/archival_or_other_unpublished_sources?rev=1303777032&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I add an archival or other unpublished source?  Click the green new item button and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdManuscript\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Enter the type of source (press release, draft, field notes, lecture notes, etc.) in the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdType\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field. Use \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdLoc. in Archive\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field to enter location of the document, i.e. box, folder, record group, etc. Use the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchive\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field to enter the name of the archive or collection. On adding letters, see How do I add a letter or memo?.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/automatic_capitalization?rev=1244663878&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2009-06-10T15:57:58-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:automatic_capitalization</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/automatic_capitalization?rev=1244663878&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I turn off automatic capitalization?  1) In the Firefox location bar (where you type web addresses), type \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdabout:config\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and hit the Enter key.  2) Find \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdextensions.zotero.capitalizeTitles\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd in the list. To find it quickly, you can type \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapitalize\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd in the Filter box.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/automatically_adding_an_article?rev=1302053526&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:32:06-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:automatically_adding_an_article</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/automatically_adding_an_article?rev=1302053526&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I automatically add an article?  Find an article in an article database such as JSTOR or Proquest. A Zotero article icon will appear in the location bar at the top of your Firefox window. Click on the icon, and the bibliographic information will appear on the right-hand side of your Zotero pane. You can then add notes, attachments, and tags. If the page has more than one article, clicking the folder icon will give you the opportunity to select which articles you want to add.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/bibliographies_in_different_languages?rev=1303749783&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T12:43:03-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:bibliographies_in_different_languages</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/bibliographies_in_different_languages?rev=1303749783&do=diff</link>         <description>Can I use Firefox and Zotero in one language and create bibliographies in another?  Yes, see .  kb,  styles</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/cert_override?rev=1426275605&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-13T15:40:05-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:cert_override</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/cert_override?rev=1426275605&do=diff</link>         <description>Zotero Standalone does not currently provide a graphical way to whitelist self-signed certificates of WebDAV servers, as is possible in Firefox.  If you use a WebDAV server with a self-signed certificate, you can open the WebDAV URL in Firefox, accept the certificate, and then copy the cert_override.txt file from the Firefox profile directory to the Zotero Standalone profile directory, located at one of the following paths:</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/changes_not_syncing?rev=1402594107&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-06-12T13:28:27-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:changes_not_syncing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/changes_not_syncing?rev=1402594107&do=diff</link>         <description>Why aren't changes I make syncing between multiple computers and/or zotero.org?  Most likely, 1) you're looking in the wrong place, 2) the sync process hasn't completed, or 3) you've received a sync error on one of your computers.  In Zotero libraries, all existing items are shown in either the library root or the trash. Make sure you're not looking in a collection that contains only some of your items. If you don't see a group in the Zotero client, make sure \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGroup Libraries\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is expanded in the\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/chicago_style_versions?rev=1389843232&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-01-15T22:33:52-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:chicago_style_versions</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/chicago_style_versions?rev=1389843232&do=diff</link>         <description>I need to use Chicago style. Which of the three versions that come with Zotero should I use?  Zotero ships with three variants of the Chicago style (formatted examples of each style are shown below). The author-date format is most popular in the physical, natural, and social sciences, whereas researchers in literary, historical, and artistic fields mostly use note-based styles. For the note-based variants, the notes can either be self-explanatory and come with or without a bibliography (full not\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/collections_containing_an_item?rev=1303775466&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T19:51:06-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:collections_containing_an_item</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/collections_containing_an_item?rev=1303775466&do=diff</link>         <description>How can I see what collections my item is in?  To see all the collections an item is in, select the item and then hold down the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOption\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd key (Mac OS X), \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdControl\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd key (Windows), or \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAlt\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd key (Linux). This will highlight all collections that contain the selected item.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/creating_bibliographies?rev=1244663878&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2009-06-10T15:57:58-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:creating_bibliographies</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/creating_bibliographies?rev=1244663878&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I create a bibliography?  Select one or more items using shift-click or ctrl-click, then right click those selected items and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCreate Bibliography\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (on a Mac, select items with shift-click and Apple-click and then ctrl-click the selected items). You can also right-click an entire Zotero folder of items (on a Mac, ctrl-click). Choose your desired citation style (APA, Chicago, or MLA), and the output format. You can save the bibliography as a rich text file (RTF), web page (HTML), or\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/default_translators?rev=1314022077&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-08-22T10:07:57-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:default_translators</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/default_translators?rev=1314022077&do=diff</link>         <description>Default translators  Zotero has four translators that attempt to find useful bibliographic data on pages that are not recognized by any of the more specific site translators. You can tell what translator detected bibliographic data on a page by placing the cursor over the document icon in the address bar; the name of the translator will show up as a tooltip. A similar name is usually saved to the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdLibrary Catalog\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field of created items.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/dependent_independent_styles?rev=1286638742&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2010-10-09T11:39:02-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:dependent_independent_styles</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/dependent_independent_styles?rev=1286638742&do=diff</link>         <description>Integrated into .</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/doi_in_bibliography?rev=1303681469&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-24T17:44:29-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:doi_in_bibliography</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/doi_in_bibliography?rev=1303681469&do=diff</link>         <description>What are these DOIs doing in my bibliography?  The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) is a unique identifier used to provide a permanent link to digital objects. DOIs are now issued to most (new) journal articles.  Several professional association style guides now specify the use of the DOI when citing journal articles. For example, APA recommends the use of the DOI over the URL.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/edited_volumes_and_book_chapters?rev=1423529072&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-09T19:44:32-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:edited_volumes_and_book_chapters</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/edited_volumes_and_book_chapters?rev=1423529072&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I add an edited volume or a book chapter?  A book chapter from an edited volume is entered as a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBook Section\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Click the green new item button and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBook Section\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. You will now see both a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdTitle\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field for the chapter title and a separate \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBook Title\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field. To add an editor click the + sign on the author line in the right column. This will create an additional Author line. If you click the triangle to the left of the new author field you will be able to change it to an editor.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/editing_metadata?rev=1302056822&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:27:02-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:editing_metadata</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/editing_metadata?rev=1302056822&do=diff</link>         <description>How can I edit item metadata?  The metadata of automatically saved items may contain errors. Click on the information you want to change in the right column of the Zotero pane: a text box will appear, allowing you to edit the text. You can change the item type using the drop-down menu at the top of the pane. You can add or delete creators by clicking on the plus or minus signs, and you can change the creator type (author, contributor, etc.) by clicking on the type label to the left of the name. \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/etymology_of_zotero?rev=1302056427&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:20:27-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:etymology_of_zotero</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/etymology_of_zotero?rev=1302056427&do=diff</link>         <description>What does \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdZotero\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd mean?  The name \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdZotero\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is loosely based on the Albanian (yes, Albanian) word zot\ufffd\ufffdroj, meaning \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdto acquire, to master,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd as in learning. If you are interested in more info see linguist Mark Dingemanse's post on The Etymology of Zotero.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/exhibit?rev=1303780037&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T21:07:17-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:exhibit</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/exhibit?rev=1303780037&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I get my Zotero collection to work with an Exhibit or Citeline presentation?  The Simile Project, sponsored by MIT, has developed several JavaScript applications that help a Zotero user integrate a bibliography into a website.  Citeline, under Simile's purview, has a Firefox plugin called Zotz to streamline the conversion process. This plug-in, however, works only with Firefox 2.0. Further, when importing the BibTeX file, the Citeline filter incorrectly handles Unicode characters beyond t\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/exporting?rev=1281748143&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2010-08-13T21:09:03-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:exporting</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/exporting?rev=1281748143&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I export my Zotero library?  To export your entire library, click on the gear icon in the Zotero toolbar and select Export Library. Group libraries are not included.  You can also select an individual collection or individual items, right-click, and choose the Export option to export only a part of your library.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/exporting_from_endnote_with_pdfs?rev=1353661401&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-11-23T04:03:21-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:exporting_from_endnote_with_pdfs</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/exporting_from_endnote_with_pdfs?rev=1353661401&do=diff</link>         <description>[deprecated] How do I import my EndNote library, complete with attached PDFs?  This procedure is no longer necessary for Zotero 3.0.9. Please refer to this article for help  Obviously, manually adding every PDF from a large EndNote library would be rather labor intensive. There is a trick to automating it, though.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/field_mappings?rev=1244667259&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2009-06-10T16:54:19-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:field_mappings</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/field_mappings?rev=1244667259&do=diff</link>         <description>Import/Export Field Mappings  Please note that Zotero and most of the formats listed on this page are in active development, which may render some of this information out-dated from time to time. If you discover any inaccuracies, by all means, feel free to correct it. Wiki logins are yours for the asking: .</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/file_handling_issues?rev=1363237528&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-03-14T01:05:28-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:file_handling_issues</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/file_handling_issues?rev=1363237528&do=diff</link>         <description>Unexpected behavior (wrong action, gibberish ("%PDF..."), etc.) when opening files from Zotero  Deleting mimeTypes.rdf from your profile directory and restarting Firefox or Zotero Standalone is generally what's needed to fix file handling issues. mimeTypes.rdf stores file handling associations and will be recreated automatically the next time you restart Firefox or Zotero Standalone.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/file_sync_errors?rev=1410552218&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-09-12T16:03:38-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:file_sync_errors</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/file_sync_errors?rev=1410552218&do=diff</link>         <description>Why do I keep getting file sync errors while syncing?  When attempting to sync many files to or from the Zotero servers \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for example, when syncing a library on a computer for the first time \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd it's not uncommon to get intermittent file sync errors. A file sync can involve thousands of network requests, and network glitches or server load can result in a small percentage of those failing. While Zotero retries many such failures automatically, others cause it to display a file sync error that stop\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/files_not_syncing?rev=1368154990&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-05-09T23:03:10-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:files_not_syncing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/files_not_syncing?rev=1368154990&do=diff</link>         <description>Why am I getting the message "Attached file could not be found. It may have been moved or deleted." when I try to open a file on a synced computer?  If file syncing isn't set up or working properly, files may be missing on some of your synced computers. Follow these steps to diagnose and fix the problem:</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/font_size?rev=1335461497&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-04-26T13:31:37-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:font_size</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/font_size?rev=1335461497&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I change the font size of text in Zotero's user interface?  You can change the font size of Zotero's user interface by visiting the General tab of the Zotero , and selecting the desired font size in the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdUser Interface\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd section.  You have to restart Firefox (Zotero for Firefox) or Zotero Standalone for the change to take effect.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/given_name_disambiguation?rev=1320179690&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-11-01T16:34:50-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:given_name_disambiguation</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/given_name_disambiguation?rev=1320179690&do=diff</link>         <description>Why do some citations include first names or initials, and how can I prevent this from happening?  Sometimes, you will see citations like \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd(J. Smith 2000, J. R. Smith 2001)\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, even though your citation style normally only shows the author's last name (\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDoe 2004\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd). In these cases, Zotero is trying to disambiguate different authors. This is generally a good thing, but disambiguation also occurs when a certain author is inconsistently named in your Zotero library. For example, Zotero treats the name\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/google_scholar_locked_me_out?rev=1270150090&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2010-04-01T15:28:10-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:google_scholar_locked_me_out</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/google_scholar_locked_me_out?rev=1270150090&do=diff</link>         <description>Google Scholar (or some other site) just locked me out, what happened?  Particularly zealous Zotero users will occasionally push the limits of what Google Scholar, or any other Zotero compatible databases, wants an individual to access in a given period of time. This tends to happen if one tries to import 50-100 items from Google Scholar either all at once or in rapid succession.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/harvard_style?rev=1303681482&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-24T17:44:42-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:harvard_style</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/harvard_style?rev=1303681482&do=diff</link>         <description>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHarvard style\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is a popular name for the author-date type of parenthetical referencing.  This way of referencing does not originate from Harvard University. There are many variants of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHarvard style\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd in use, and there is no \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdofficial\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Harvard Style. Therefore, you should either consult the style guide of your own institution or of your professional association.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/highlighting_and_annotating_pdfs?rev=1244663878&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2009-06-10T15:57:58-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:highlighting_and_annotating_pdfs</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/highlighting_and_annotating_pdfs?rev=1244663878&do=diff</link>         <description>Can I use Zotero's highlighting and annotation tools on PDFs?  Zotero's annotation features only work with HTML documents. You cannot use them with archived PDFs. You will need to use third party tools to annotate and highlight inside PDFs.  kb</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/httpserver_enabled?rev=1329462956&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-02-17T02:15:56-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:httpserver_enabled</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/httpserver_enabled?rev=1329462956&do=diff</link>         <description>How can I use the Chrome or Safari Connectors with Zotero for Firefox?   allow you to save items to Zotero from within browsers other than Firefox, using Zotero's site translators. Currently Zotero has to be open in order to save items through Zotero Connectors from most websites.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/idem?rev=1411159716&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-09-19T16:48:36-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:idem</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/idem?rev=1411159716&do=diff</link>         <description>How can subsequent occurencies of the same author replaced by a fixed term/symbol?  Some citation styles require to replace any subsequent occurencies of the same author/bookauthor/editor by idem/eadem, their abbreviations id./ead., or some other term or symbol like a dash.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/import_from_clipboard?rev=1377812999&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-08-29T17:49:59-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:import_from_clipboard</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/import_from_clipboard?rev=1377812999&do=diff</link>         <description>How does the Import from Clipboard feature work?  Import from Clipboard allows you to import items from the raw code of any supported format (RIS, BibTeX, etc.). Many websites post the bibliographic data for items in their raw form. To add these items to your Zotero library, select and copy the code from the site, then import through the menu option in the Actions button of the Zotero toolbar, or by the keyboard shortcut (Cmd-Shift-V/Ctrl-Shift-V).</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/importing?rev=1347259013&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-09-10T02:36:53-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:importing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/importing?rev=1347259013&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I import references into Zotero?  Zotero's \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdImport\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd function imports citation data from bibliographic formats such as bibtex or RIS. To get files like PDFs into Zotero, simply drag&drop  them to the Zotero interface or use \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdStore Copy of File\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. See here for more information on getting files into Zotero.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/importing_formatted_bibliographies?rev=1402646077&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-06-13T03:54:37-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:importing_formatted_bibliographies</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/importing_formatted_bibliographies?rev=1402646077&do=diff</link>         <description>I have bibliographies in Microsoft Word documents, PDFs, and other text files. Can I import them into my Zotero collection?  No. Zotero cannot currently import items from bibliographies in text documents. While this may sound like a simple request, it is actually rather difficult to accomplish given the range of potential formats.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/importing_records_from_endnote?rev=1415312528&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-06T17:22:08-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:importing_records_from_endnote</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/importing_records_from_endnote?rev=1415312528&do=diff</link>         <description>Many people coming to Zotero already have extensive collections stored in other reference management software. The following information describes how to make the move from EndNote to Zotero, but the same basic steps apply to many other reference management systems that can export to the RIS format.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/incomplete_cert_chain?rev=1406666065&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-07-29T16:34:25-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:incomplete_cert_chain</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/incomplete_cert_chain?rev=1406666065&do=diff</link>         <description>"[Proxy or WebDAV URL] uses an invalid security certificate. The certificate is not trusted because [\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd]"  Summary  If a Zotero Standalone error report shows an error similar to the above for your institution's proxy or WebDAV server, the server is likely misconfigured and will need to be fixed by your IT department. Point them to this page along with the URL from the error report.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/italics_in_word_bibliographies?rev=1412348827&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-10-03T11:07:07-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:italics_in_word_bibliographies</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/italics_in_word_bibliographies?rev=1412348827&do=diff</link>         <description>On rare occasions, you will find that your Zotero bibliography in Word is missing italics, even though those are required for book titles in the citation style you've chosen. Sometimes you will find the reverse: the entire bibliography is in italics.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/item_count?rev=1303775493&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T19:51:33-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:item_count</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/item_count?rev=1303775493&do=diff</link>         <description>How can I see how many items I have in my Zotero library?  To see how many items you have, click an item in the middle column and Select All (Command-A on Mac OS X or Control-A on Windows). A count of selected items will appear in the right column.  To determine total items, including child attachments and notes, click an item and press the + (plus) key to expand all parent items before using Select All. You can press - (minus) afterward to collapse all items.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/item_types_and_fields?rev=1397241375&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-04-11T14:36:15-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:item_types_and_fields</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/item_types_and_fields?rev=1397241375&do=diff</link>         <description>This is a work in progress on a guide to entering information into Zotero manually.  Generic Fields  The following fields exist across multiple item types and have the same purpose for all types Field  Description Abstract  Short description of the workAccessed  Date an electronic resource was accessed. Typically filled automatically. Accepts various date formats, including \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtoday,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdyesterday,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtomorrow\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchive   Mainly for archival resources, the archive where an item was found. Note that\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/journal_abbreviations?rev=1365551618&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-04-09T19:53:38-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:journal_abbreviations</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/journal_abbreviations?rev=1365551618&do=diff</link>         <description>Many citation styles require that journal titles are abbreviated (e.g. using a journal abbreviation list).  Zotero 4.0 and later can automatically abbreviate journal titles in Index Medicus/MEDLINE format. This option is available in the Document Preferences window. When it is disabled, Zotero uses the abbreviation from the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdJournal Abbr.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field in the client.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/keyboard_shortcuts_in_word_plugin?rev=1333042763&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-03-29T13:39:23-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:keyboard_shortcuts_in_word_plugin</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/keyboard_shortcuts_in_word_plugin?rev=1333042763&do=diff</link>         <description>This page has .</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/library_items?rev=1303779414&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:56:54-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:library_items</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/library_items?rev=1303779414&do=diff</link>         <description>A Zotero library is made up of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffditems\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Items can take several forms: regular items, attachments, and notes.  All items can have tags applied to them and can be linked to related items.   Regular Items  The foundational elements in most Zotero libraries, regular items take the form of reference types---books, journal articles, manuscripts---and have associated bibliographic  metadata (Title, Author, Publisher, etc.). Regular items can be created manually by using the New Item drop-down menu or a\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/library_sorting?rev=1303775730&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T19:55:30-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:library_sorting</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/library_sorting?rev=1303775730&do=diff</link>         <description>Can I change the way items are sorted in my library?  Yes, you can sort your Zotero library and individual collections within it alphabetically, numerically, and chronologically, in ascending or descending order, by various fields. You can choose the sort field by clicking on the column heading, such as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdTitle\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd or \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCreator\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, at the top of Zotero's center pane. Click again on the same heading to reverse the sort direction.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/links_vs_snapshots?rev=1303778502&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:41:42-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:links_vs_snapshots</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/links_vs_snapshots?rev=1303778502&do=diff</link>         <description>What is the difference between Links and Snapshots?  When you attach a link to an item, Zotero stores only the page title, URL, and access date, and you need to return to the site to view the page content. When you save a snapshot, Zotero saves a copy of the page as it currently exists and archives it on your computer.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/linux_packaging?rev=1372105717&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-06-24T16:28:37-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:linux_packaging</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/linux_packaging?rev=1372105717&do=diff</link>         <description>Does Zotero offer installable packages of Zotero Standalone for specific Linux distributions?  No. Zotero distributes Zotero Standalone the same way that Mozilla distributes Firefox: as a tarball that can be extracted and run manually or packaged by others according to distribution-specific standards. Some that have been packaged are</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/manually_adding_items?rev=1303776602&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:10:02-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:manually_adding_items</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/manually_adding_items?rev=1303776602&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I manually add a bibliographic item?  You can manually add items by clicking the green circle with a plus icon above the middle column, selecting the appropriate item type, and filling in the bibliographic details in the right column. New items will appear in the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMy Library\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd folder and can be organized into other folders.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/merging_libraries?rev=1303779375&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:56:15-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:merging_libraries</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/merging_libraries?rev=1303779375&do=diff</link>         <description>I have two Zotero libraries. How can I combine them?  You will want to export one library as Zotero RDF and import the .rdf file into the second library. To do this, click the Actions (gear icon) menu and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdExport Library...\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. The default export format should be \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdZotero RDF\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, which you should leave selected. You can check the boxes for including files and notes if you would like to transfer those to the other library. Click OK, name the RDF file, and choose a destination to save it. You ca\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/merging_tags?rev=1303776163&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:02:43-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:merging_tags</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/merging_tags?rev=1303776163&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I merge tags?  Equivalent tags (e.g. \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdwebpage\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdwebsite\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd) can be merged by renaming one tag to the name of the other. Right-click one of the tags in the tag selector (bottom left of the Zotero pane), select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRename Tag...\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and enter the name of the matching tag.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/missing_item_tabs?rev=1303777707&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:28:27-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:missing_item_tabs</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/missing_item_tabs?rev=1303777707&do=diff</link>         <description>Why don't I see any tabs in the right-hand column after selecting an item in the middle column?  You have selected either an attachment or a note in the middle column of the Zotero pane. Attachments and notes do not have full bibliographic metadata and cannot have other items attached to them, so you will not see the Info, Notes, Attachments, Tags, and Related tabs when you select them. Only regular items---with reference types such as books, journal articles, and newspaper articles---will show \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/missing_link_and_snapshot_buttons?rev=1269598244&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2010-03-26T06:10:44-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:missing_link_and_snapshot_buttons</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/missing_link_and_snapshot_buttons?rev=1269598244&do=diff</link>         <description>Where are the link and snapshot buttons in Zotero 2.0?  The separate link and snapshot buttons were removed from the Zotero toolbar in Zotero 2.0, but equivalent functionality still exists through the use of the Create New Item from Current Page button.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/newer_db_version?rev=1383711608&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-11-05T23:20:08-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:newer_db_version</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/newer_db_version?rev=1383711608&do=diff</link>         <description>Why am I getting a database version error?  After reinstalling Zotero, or after switching between Zotero for Firefox and Zotero Standalone, you may see the following error message when you you try to open Zotero:  This version of Zotero is older than the version last used with your database. Please upgrade to the latest version from zotero.org.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/no_address_bar_icon?rev=1384238866&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-11-12T01:47:46-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:no_address_bar_icon</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/no_address_bar_icon?rev=1384238866&do=diff</link>         <description>Why don't I see a Zotero icon in the address bar when viewing a web page?  Zotero senses information on web pages through site translators, and a Zotero icon will appear only if a site translator recognizes the page being viewed. Zotero's translators should work with most library catalogs, popular websites such as Amazon and the New York Times, and many gated databases.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/no_toolbar_icon?rev=1415691699&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-11T02:41:39-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:no_toolbar_icon</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/no_toolbar_icon?rev=1415691699&do=diff</link>         <description>Why is there no Zotero icon in the Firefox toolbar after installing or upgrading Zotero for Firefox?  First make sure you're looking in the right place. Mozilla removed the status bar/add-on bar in Firefox 29. Zotero can now be opened from an icon in the main Firefox toolbar or the new Firefox menu panel.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/no_toolbar_in_word_2008_plugin?rev=1336711042&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-05-11T00:37:22-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:no_toolbar_in_word_2008_plugin</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/no_toolbar_in_word_2008_plugin?rev=1336711042&do=diff</link>         <description>Where is the Zotero toolbar in Word for Mac 2008?  The Zotero  for Word for Mac 2008 doesn't offer a toolbar, instead adding a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdZotero\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd entry to the AppleScript menu (the manuscript icon to the right of the Help menu):    Most menu commands are also available through shortcut keys.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/non-western_characters?rev=1303778430&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-25T20:40:30-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:non-western_characters</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/non-western_characters?rev=1303778430&do=diff</link>         <description>Does Zotero support non-Western characters?  Yes, Zotero is Unicode-compliant and can process non-Western characters.  kb,  basics</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/online_library_empty?rev=1267991184&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2010-03-07T14:46:24-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:online_library_empty</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/online_library_empty?rev=1267991184&do=diff</link>         <description>Why don't I see my library when I log into the Zotero website?  When you create a library using the Zotero Firefox extension, data is saved to your own computer. Your library will not appear on zotero.org unless you sync your library with the Zotero server. To view your local library, click the Zotero icon in the Firefox status bar or select Zotero from the Firefox Tools menu.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/opening_and_closing_zotero?rev=1377812912&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-08-29T17:48:32-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:opening_and_closing_zotero</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/opening_and_closing_zotero?rev=1377812912&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I open and close my Zotero pane?  Click on the Zotero icon at the bottom of your Mozilla Firefox browser window to open the pane. You can add a Zotero icon to your toolbar at the top of your browser window by clicking on View \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Toolbars \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Customize.  You can close the pane by clicking the Zotero icon (either in toolbar or on bottom of your browser window or by clicking on the X icon on the right. You can also open or close pane from the keyboard: Ctrl-Shift-Z on Windows/Linux or Shift-Com\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/opening_snapshots_in_a_new_tab?rev=1335463211&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-04-26T14:00:11-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:opening_snapshots_in_a_new_tab</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/opening_snapshots_in_a_new_tab?rev=1335463211&do=diff</link>         <description>Can I open snapshots in a new tab or window? (Zotero for Firefox)  Yes. When you double click a snapshot in your Zotero library, or right-click the snapshot and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdView Snapshot\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, the snapshot will open in the currently active Firefox tab. To open the snapshot in a new tab and keep focus on the current tab, select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdView Snapshot\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd while holding the Control key (Command key on OS X). To open the snapshot in a new tab and shift focus to the new tab, select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdView Snapshot\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd while holding the Con\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/organizing_a_library?rev=1302052773&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:19:33-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:organizing_a_library</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/organizing_a_library?rev=1302052773&do=diff</link>         <description>What ways can I organize and manage my collections?  \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMy Library\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd holds every item in your collection. To organize these items, you can create folders and subfolders on the left side of your Zotero pane. Click on the New Collection icon to create a new folder. You can create a subfolder by creating a new collection and dragging it into another collection. To rename a collection, right-click on it (control-click on Macs) and select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRename Collection.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Drag in items from the middle pane to add th\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/outlining_with_notes?rev=1302053544&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:32:24-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:outlining_with_notes</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/outlining_with_notes?rev=1302053544&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I organize my notes into an outline?  See Using Reports to Organize Your Notes.  kb,  organizing</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/portable_firefox?rev=1414486701&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-10-28T04:58:21-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:portable_firefox</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/portable_firefox?rev=1414486701&do=diff</link>         <description>If you are unable to install Firefox on a computer, you may still be able to use Zotero by using Portable Firefox from an external drive (e.g. a USB drive).  Caution!  While these instructions do not refer to such a setting, do NOT, at any point, set AllowMultipleInstances=true inside the FirefoxPortable.ini file. This option directs Portable Firefox to be started with the -no-remote flag, which disrupts communication between Zotero for Firefox and the Word/LibreOffice plugins as well as Zotero \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/preferences?rev=1302056634&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:23:54-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:preferences</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/preferences?rev=1302056634&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I change Zotero preferences?  There are two ways to access the Zotero Preferences Window.     *  In Zotero, select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdPreferences...\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd from the Action drop-down menu (the gear icon in the upper right of the pane).  *  In Firefox Tools menu, select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAdd-ons,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and then click \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdZotero\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd under the Extensions tab.  A Preferences button will appear.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/preventing_title_casing_for_non-english_titles?rev=1331298844&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-03-09T08:14:04-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:preventing_title_casing_for_non-english_titles</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/preventing_title_casing_for_non-english_titles?rev=1331298844&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I prevent Title Casing of non-English titles in bibliographies?  Some CSL citation styles, such as the Chicago Manual of Style styles, convert titles to Title Case. However, Title Casing is specific to English. To prevent non-English titles from being Title Cased, specify the language of the corresponding item in your Zotero library using the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdlanguage\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd field.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/printing_references_and_notes?rev=1244663878&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2009-06-10T15:57:58-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:printing_references_and_notes</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/printing_references_and_notes?rev=1244663878&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I print my Zotero references and notes?  Select the collection or items you would like to print out in your report with your cursor and then right click on them (ctrl-click on a Mac). Select \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGenerate report from selected item.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A report featuring all of your Zotero information should pop up in your browser.  If there are any notes associated with individual items or collections, those will be included with the report.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/profile_directory?rev=1363237453&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-03-14T01:04:13-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:profile_directory</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/profile_directory?rev=1363237453&do=diff</link>         <description>Profile directory location  Zotero for Firefox  Follow these instructions to locate your profile directory.  Zotero Standalone  You can find your Zotero Standalone profile directory in the following location: OS X /Users/<username>/Library/Application Support/Zotero/Profiles/<randomstring></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/proxy_troubleshooting?rev=1334860316&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-04-19T14:31:56-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:proxy_troubleshooting</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/proxy_troubleshooting?rev=1334860316&do=diff</link>         <description>Why can't I access a proxied site when Zotero is enabled?  When you attempt to access a site that you've previously accessed through a proxy server, Zotero can automatically redirect you through your proxy.  If a site is inaccessible through Firefox when Zotero is enabled but works in other browsers or when Zotero is disabled, there may be a problem with a proxy setting that Zotero has stored.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/repeated_conflicts?rev=1402594107&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-06-12T13:28:27-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:repeated_conflicts</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/repeated_conflicts?rev=1402594107&do=diff</link>         <description>Why does Zotero keep asking me to reconcile the same conflicts whenever I sync?  First, be sure you're not cancelling the conflict resolution process: you need to click Next/Finish in the bottom-right corner of the conflict resolution window after making each change. If you don't see a Next/Finish button, you may need to enlarge the window. (This should only be an issue on computers with low-resolution screens.)</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/requesting_styles_for_editors?rev=1303681021&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-24T17:37:01-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:requesting_styles_for_editors</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/requesting_styles_for_editors?rev=1303681021&do=diff</link>         <description>I'm the publisher/editor of a journal. What can I do to have Zotero support our style?  Fantastic! You are the perfect person to get your style supported and approved.  Zotero uses the Citation Style Language (CSL). By helping to create a CSL style, you also create a style that can be used by Mendeley and Papers2.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/resizing_the_zotero_pane?rev=1302056541&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:22:21-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:resizing_the_zotero_pane</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/resizing_the_zotero_pane?rev=1302056541&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I change the size of my Zotero pane?  You can toggle between a full screen and a smaller screen by clicking on the toggle icon on the right side of the Zotero pane. You can also click and drag your Zotero pane to resize it. You can place your Zotero pane either at the bottom of your page or at the top by clicking on the Zotero gear icon and selecting Preferences.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/rich_text_bibliography?rev=1358268714&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-01-15T11:51:54-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:rich_text_bibliography</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/rich_text_bibliography?rev=1358268714&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I use rich text formatting, like italics and sub/superscript, in titles?  You can apply rich text formatting by manually adding the following HTML-like tags to fields in your Zotero library:   *  <i> and </i> for italics  *  <b> and </b> for bold  *  <sub> and </sub> for subscript  *  <sup> and </sup> for superscript  *  <span style="font-variant:small-caps;"> and </span> for</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/saving_work?rev=1302056611&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:23:31-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:saving_work</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/saving_work?rev=1302056611&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I save my work?  Zotero automatically saves everything as you enter it.  kb,  entry</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/secondary_citation?rev=1418078456&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-12-08T17:40:56-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:secondary_citation</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/secondary_citation?rev=1418078456&do=diff</link>         <description>How do you cite a secondary source in Zotero  see <https://forums.zotero.org/discussion/42244/secondary-citation-in-turabian/>  kb,  styles</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sentence_casing?rev=1414231113&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-10-25T05:58:33-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:sentence_casing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sentence_casing?rev=1414231113&do=diff</link>         <description>Why don't titles show up in sentence case in bibliographies?  Some styles, such as APA, demand the use of sentence case for titles (e.g., \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOxidation and reduction of iron by acidophilic bacteria\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd). Others, like the Chicago Manual of Style, require title case (\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOxidation and Reduction of Iron by Acidophilic Bacteria\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd).</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sharing_data_directory?rev=1418413214&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-12-12T14:40:14-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:sharing_data_directory</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sharing_data_directory?rev=1418413214&do=diff</link>         <description>When you install both Zotero Standalone and Zotero for Firefox, you will be asked if you want to share your data directory. The general recommendation is to respond \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdYes\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, because this will usually do what you expect Zotero to do. Here's some more detail on what's going on.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/site_access_limits?rev=1302056525&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:22:05-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:site_access_limits</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/site_access_limits?rev=1302056525&do=diff</link>         <description>Google Scholar (or some other site) locked me out after using Zotero to save items. What happened?  Particularly zealous Zotero users will occasionally push the limits of what Google Scholar, or any other Zotero-compatible database, wants an individual to access in a given period of time, and you may see a message like the following:</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/site_certificate_info?rev=1417041272&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-26T17:34:32-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:site_certificate_info</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/site_certificate_info?rev=1417041272&do=diff</link>         <description>Viewing zotero.org Certificate Information  When encountering certain errors in Zotero, viewing the certificate information for zotero.org in your web browser may provide more details on what is causing the problem on your system. If you share this information in the Zotero Forums, we may be able to help identify what is interfering (or it may be self-explanatory, based on, for example, the name of your institution or security software on your system).</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/snapshot_is_unreadable?rev=1302055868&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:11:08-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:snapshot_is_unreadable</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/snapshot_is_unreadable?rev=1302055868&do=diff</link>         <description>My snapshot is unreadable because flash ads appear on top of article text. How do I get a better snapshot?  Look for a printer friendly version, then save the snapshot. Print versions of articles usually only have one ad on top and their snapshots are easier to read.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/snapshot_only_captures_first_page?rev=1302053415&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:30:15-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:snapshot_only_captures_first_page</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/snapshot_only_captures_first_page?rev=1302053415&do=diff</link>         <description>A snapshot only captures the first of multiple pages of a New York Times article. How do I get Zotero to capture the full article?  The web snapshot feature only captures the current page. Many sites, like the New York Times, will only display part of the document you are interested in on the first page. A general rule for working around this issue is to look for a printer friendly version.  This will generate a page that has all of the document available on one page. You can now capture the ful\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sorting_notes?rev=1302052916&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:21:56-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:sorting_notes</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sorting_notes?rev=1302052916&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I sort my notes by page number?  Notes are sorted alphabetically by default, so you can start each note with the page number, adding leading zeros, i.e. [002], [045], [367]. For multiple notes from the same page, enter [367a], [367b], etc.  kb,  organizing</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/ssl_certificate_error?rev=1418550674&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-12-14T04:51:14-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:ssl_certificate_error</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/ssl_certificate_error?rev=1418550674&do=diff</link>         <description>"SSL certificate error connecting to sync.zotero.org"  The above message sync error generally indicates a problem with either your Firefox installation (if you're using Zotero for Firefox) or your computer/network. The zotero.org SSL certificate should always be valid.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/storing_files?rev=1302054275&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:44:35-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:storing_files</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/storing_files?rev=1302054275&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I attach a file or web page to an item?  After adding an item to your library, click on the Attachments tab in the right-hand section of the Zotero pane. A pull-down menu will allow you to add a link to a file stored elsewhere on your hard disk, copy a file to your Zotero storage directory, add a link to the current web page, or save a snapshot of the current web page.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/style_standards?rev=1320762211&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-11-08T09:23:31-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:style_standards</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/style_standards?rev=1320762211&do=diff</link>         <description>Professional associations produce style guides in order to standardise citation methods in their field.  These standards should be adhered to, unless there is a very good reason to use or create another style.  Below is a list of some professional association style guides.  Corresponding CSL styles for most of them are at the .</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/style_wrong?rev=1287084514&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2010-10-14T15:28:34-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:style_wrong</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/style_wrong?rev=1287084514&do=diff</link>         <description>Integrated into the  page.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sync_queuing?rev=1401146364&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-05-26T19:19:24-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:sync_queuing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sync_queuing?rev=1401146364&do=diff</link>         <description>Why is my sync icon spinning constantly?  Short answer: Wait. Do not restart Zotero/Firefox or try to clear or reset anything, which will likely simply cause you to wait longer.  Long answer: When Zotero syncs with the server, requests go into a queue on the server. The time it takes for your request to be processed depends on the size of the request (i.e., how much data you're trying to upload or download) and the number of users currently syncing. Sync times may range from a few seconds to, fo\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sync_reset_options?rev=1318520323&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-10-13T11:38:43-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:sync_reset_options</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/sync_reset_options?rev=1318520323&do=diff</link>         <description>Sync Server Reset Options  The following operations are for use only in rare, specific situations and should not be used for general troubleshooting. In many cases, resetting will cause additional problems.  By default, the Zotero sync process merges data between the Zotero client and the Zotero server. In certain rare situations, you may prefer to overwrite all data on one side with data from the other side. The reset mode to use depends on your situation:</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/tei?rev=1323977225&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-12-15T14:27:05-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:tei</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/tei?rev=1323977225&do=diff</link>         <description>The Text Encoding Initiative is a consortium that curates an international standard for the XML markup of texts. The standard enjoys broad support among libraries, museums, publishers, and scholars. Web-based TEI-compliant documents are found in increasing numbers online.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/transferring_a_library?rev=1359908963&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-02-03T11:29:23-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:transferring_a_library</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/transferring_a_library?rev=1359908963&do=diff</link>         <description>How can I move my Zotero library to a different computer?  Option A: Copy the Library Folder  The most reliable way to move your entire library to another machine is to copy the Zotero data folder from your Firefox/Zotero profile on the first machine to the Firefox/Zotero profile on your new machine.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/uninstalling?rev=1302056578&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:22:58-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:uninstalling</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/uninstalling?rev=1302056578&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I uninstall Zotero?  You can uninstall Zotero just like any other Firefox extension by going to the Firefox menu Tools->Add-ons->Extensions tab, selecting Zotero, and clicking \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdUninstall.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd  The Zotero data directory is not removed when you uninstall Zotero.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/unresponsive_script_warning?rev=1328381006&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-02-04T13:43:26-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:unresponsive_script_warning</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/unresponsive_script_warning?rev=1328381006&do=diff</link>         <description>Why am I getting an "unresponsive script warning"?  While Zotero is performing long operations, Firefox may display the message:  \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdA script on this page may be busy, or it may have stopped responding. You can stop the script now, or you can continue to see if the script will complete.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/update_checks?rev=1302057120&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:32:00-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:update_checks</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/update_checks?rev=1302057120&do=diff</link>         <description>Zotero seems to be \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdphoning\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd home without telling me what it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds doing. What\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds going on?  Similar to other Firefox extensions (and other software in general), Zotero checks periodically for updates from the Center for History and New Media servers. In particular, we are constantly adding support for new catalogs and sites, and we push these changes out to current users once a day. In no way is Zotero reporting on what you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre doing, looking at, etc. We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre just upgrading the software to support more\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/updates_not_detected?rev=1422737818&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-01-31T15:56:58-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:updates_not_detected</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/updates_not_detected?rev=1422737818&do=diff</link>         <description>Why isn't Firefox detecting Zotero updates?  No automatic updates are found, but manual update checks work  If you're not receiving automatic updates to the Zotero Firefox extensions but you can find updates manually in the Firefox add-ons window, go to the Firefox preferences -> Advanced -> Update and make sure that Firefox is set to automatically install updates.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/user_interface_language?rev=1335461114&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-04-26T13:25:14-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:user_interface_language</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/user_interface_language?rev=1335461114&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I change the language of Zotero's user interface?  See .  kb,  basics</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/using_multiple_computers?rev=1302052200&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:10:00-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:using_multiple_computers</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/using_multiple_computers?rev=1302052200&do=diff</link>         <description>How can I access my library from multiple computers?  Can I store my Zotero library and associated files on an external drive?  The best way to access your Zotero library from multiple computers is to  your libraries automatically via the Zotero server. If, for whatever reason, you cannot use Zotero's built in sync features consider the options below.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/using_site_translators?rev=1302053516&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T21:31:56-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:using_site_translators</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/using_site_translators?rev=1302053516&do=diff</link>         <description>How do I automatically add a book?  Find a book on your library catalog website. A Zotero book icon will appear in the location bar at the top of your Firefox window. Click on the icon, and the bibliographic information will appear on the right side of your Zotero pane. You can then add notes, attachments, and tags. You can also edit citation information. If the page has more than one book, clicking the folder icon will give you the opportunity to select which books you want to add.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/webdav_services?rev=1424269435&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-18T09:23:55-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:webdav_services</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/webdav_services?rev=1424269435&do=diff</link>         <description>This page contains a list of WebDAV services that provide a free plan that is known to work with Zotero. The limitations column lists the limitations in the free plan. All service providers offer also larger and less limited paid plans. The list is not exhaustive, the fact that some service provider is not listed does not mean that their service would not work.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/word_default_font?rev=1325177241&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-12-29T11:47:21-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:word_default_font</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/word_default_font?rev=1325177241&do=diff</link>         <description>References appear in the wrong font in Word/LibreOffice  The word processor plug-ins apply the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffddefault\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (LibreOffice/OpenOffice) or \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdNormal\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd/\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdStandard\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (Word) style to generated citations and the paragraph in which they are inserted. The bibliography is rendered in a different style - \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdbibliography\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. As a result, inserting a citation with Zotero can remove formatting (such as indents, line-spacing, font size, etc.) from an entire paragraph and the citation can appear in an unwanted font or form\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/zotero_and_wikipedia?rev=1305301024&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-05-13T11:37:04-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:zotero_and_wikipedia</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/zotero_and_wikipedia?rev=1305301024&do=diff</link>         <description>Zotero and Wikipedia  Zotero can be a powerful tool for Wikipedia users, be they casual visitors or regular contributors. By incorporating print-based references, Wikipedia users are able lend greater credibility to their articles and provide readers with a broader reference base, forging new relationships between online and offline resources. Wikipedia employs its own format for bibliographic citations, known as Wikipedia Citation Templates. Because the Wikipedia Citation Templates for books an\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/zotero_pane_not_opening?rev=1302056665&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2011-04-05T22:24:25-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:zotero_pane_not_opening</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/zotero_pane_not_opening?rev=1302056665&do=diff</link>         <description>Zotero doesn't open when I click the Zotero status bar icon or select "Zotero" from the Firefox Tools menu.  Disable all other Firefox extensions, beginning with those that are known to cause problems with Zotero.  If disabling all extensions allows you to open Zotero, re-enable your extensions one-by-one, restarting Firefox each time, until you find the conflicting extension. If the conflicting extension isn't listed on the Known Issues page, report it in the forums. You should also contact the\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/zotero_version?rev=1354221989&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-11-29T15:46:29-04:00</dc:date>         <title>kb:zotero_version</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/zotero_version?rev=1354221989&do=diff</link>         <description>What version of Zotero do I have?  You can check your Zotero version by selecting About Zotero from the gear menu in the Zotero toolbar or, for Zotero for Firefox, via Tools -> Add-ons -> Extensions.  You can upgrade to the latest version of Zotero by clicking Download on the .</description>     </item> </rdf:RDF>
